source: Original content based on Docker documentation

questions.title: DOCKER_IMAGE_001
questions.question: Which command builds a Docker image from a Dockerfile in the current directory?
questions.explanation: docker build . builds an image from Dockerfile in the current directory.

questions.title: DOCKER_CONTAINER_001
questions.question: Which flag runs a container in detached mode?
questions.explanation: -d or --detach flag runs container in background and prints container ID.

questions.title: DOCKER_VOLUME_001
questions.question: Which Docker storage type persists data after container removal?
questions.explanation: Volumes are stored in Docker-managed directory and persist after container deletion.

questions.title: DOCKER_NETWORK_001
questions.question: What is the default network driver for Docker containers?
questions.explanation: bridge is the default network driver for standalone containers.

questions.title: DOCKER_COMPOSE_001
questions.question: Which Docker Compose command starts services in detached mode?
questions.explanation: docker-compose up -d creates and starts containers in detached mode.

questions.title: DOCKER_REGISTRY_001
questions.question: Which command pushes an image to Docker Hub?
questions.explanation: docker push uploads an image to a registry like Docker Hub.

questions.title: DOCKER_LOGS_001
questions.question: Which command shows the last 50 lines of logs from container myapp?
questions.explanation: docker logs with --tail flag limits output to specified number of lines from the end.

questions.title: DOCKER_EXEC_001
questions.question: How do you execute an interactive bash shell in running container myapp?
questions.explanation: docker exec -it runs a command in a running container with interactive TTY.

questions.title: DOCKER_HEALTHCHECK_001
questions.question: In a Dockerfile, which instruction defines a health check?
questions.explanation: HEALTHCHECK instruction tells Docker how to test if container is still working.

questions.title: DOCKER_MULTISTAGE_001
questions.question: What is the benefit of multi-stage builds in Docker?
questions.explanation: Multi-stage builds allow copying only necessary artifacts, resulting in smaller production images.

questions.title: DOCKER_SWARM_001
questions.question: Which command initializes a new Docker Swarm?
questions.explanation: docker swarm init initializes a swarm and makes the current node a manager.

questions.title: DOCKER_PRUNE_001
questions.question: Which command removes all unused containers, networks, and images?
questions.explanation: docker system prune -a removes all unused containers, networks, images, and volumes.
